@Victsm what will be happened if we continue to enable `SparkSession` but without hive class presented?
@jerryshao we should probably get this merged sooner rather than later
Sure, I see.
Ack, I just noticed that Livy isn't capitalized in the NOTICE file, is it possible to do an amend to fix that?
Maybe we can fix it later with other docs related PRs.
I added the fix as a nit in the PR this spun off from
LGTM, merging to master.
@weiqingy can you remove "WIP" tag, looks like I don't have the permission to change the title.
Yes, title has been changed. Thanks for the review, @jerryshao
Great, thanks for your work.

@jerryshao I moved the docs back into this PR so we can focus on reviewing these changes then I can follow up with a PR that actually lets us build the Docs like in Spark and deploy them to the website.
Created [LIVY-384](https://issues.cloudera.org/browse/LIVY-384) for followup mentioned above

**Feedback Question:**
Currently I'm just displaying the log as a text dump, but should I address the following:
* Parse the log for `stdout`, `stderr`, and `YARN Diagnostics` so as to separate them
* Restrict the log size and implement a form of scrolling (like Spark's Log Page)
@jerryshao Here's the next UI PR
@jerryshao addressed your comments, what do you think about my "Note" ?
LGTM, we could update the docs later when we have a first Apache release. I'm thinking of kicking off a first Apache release when all the migration things are done.

Yeah we should probably get it out soon, I'll try to speed up my web ui work so it can all get out in the release (I believe my only key remaining work after my current pr is auth support and selenium tests)
Thanks! Will merge it after travis test finished.
@ajbozarth can you please retrigger the travis?

> Parse the log for stdout, stderr, and YARN Diagnostics so as to separate them

This would be good if it is not difficult to achieve.

>Restrict the log size and implement a form of scrolling (like Spark's Log Page)

Here based on you implementation, we will only show 100 lines of logs at most, do you think it is necessary to add a form scrolling?

I'll separate out stderr/stdout/YARN tomorrow.

And by scrolling I meant a form of infinite scrolling (which I implemented on Sparks Log Page), though after your comment about 100 lines and my suggestion on splitting up the log I've realized that if stderr or stdout was too long YARN Diag won't even load. So I will probably implement a way to load the whole log no matter length and have scrolling within each of the "sub-logs"
Merging this as a simple fix.

Also based on everything I'm realizing in this conversation I may toy will how the logs are stored and accessed in order to better facilitate this page. (Without changing current API functionality of course)
I'm going to merge this, since it is an unrelated failure.

@jerryshao 

Spark side will throw CNF exceptions when initializing `HiveSessionState`.

Pushed an update addressing the log length, after a little work I found that separating out the different logs is simple, but from a UI perspective splitting them up doesn't do much without optimizing the UI for multiple logs, therefore I'm splitting off a followup JIRA to deal with splitting up the logs so we can merge more of the UI now and move forward with a 0.4 release faster.
opened up followup JIRA mentioned above: https://issues.cloudera.org/browse/LIVY-387
